channel.title: Zarathustra. A God That Can Dance on Osho - The complete works of Osho
channel.description: Recent content in Zarathustra. A God That Can Dance on Osho - The complete works of Osho

image.title: Osho - The complete works of Osho

item.title: 1 Prologue part 1
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 1 Prologue part 1 26 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART 1 WHEN ZARATHUSTRA WAS THIRTY YEARS OLD, HE LEFT HIS HOME AND THE LAKE OF HIS HOME AND WENT INTO THE MOUNTAINS. HERE HE HAD THE ENJOYMENT OF HIS SPIRIT AND HIS SOLITUDE AND HE DID NOT WEARY OF IT FOR TEN YEARS. BUT AT LAST HIS HEART TURNED – AND ONE MORNING HE ROSE WITH THE DAWN, STEPPED BEFORE THE SUN AND SPOKE TO IT THUS:

item.title: 10 Of the new idol and of the flies of the marketplace
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 10 Of the new idol and of the flies of the marketplace 31 March 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE NEW IDOL THERE ARE STILL PEOPLES AND HERDS SOMEWHERE, BUT NOT WITH US, MY BROTHERS: HERE THERE ARE STATES.… THE STATE IS THE COLDEST OF ALL COLD MONSTERS. COLDLY IT LIES, TOO; AND THIS LIE CREEPS FROM ITS MOUTH: ‘I, THE STATE, AM THE PEOPLE.

item.title: 11 Of the friend
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 11 Of the friend 31 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE FRIEND OUR FAITH IN OTHERS BETRAYS WHEREIN WE WOULD DEARLY LIKE TO HAVE FAITH IN OURSELVES. OUR LONGING FOR A FRIEND IS OUR BETRAYER. AND OFTEN WITH OUR LOVE WE ONLY WANT TO LEAP OVER ENVY. AND OFTEN WE ATTACK AND MAKE AN ENEMY IN ORDER TO CONCEAL THAT WE ARE VULNERABLE TO ATTACK.

item.title: 12 Of the thousand and one goals
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 12 Of the thousand and one goals 1 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE THOUSAND AND ONE GOALS NO PEOPLE COULD LIVE WITHOUT EVALUATING; BUT IF IT WISHES TO MAINTAIN ITSELF IT MUST NOT EVALUATE AS ITS NEIGHBOR EVALUATES. MUCH THAT SEEMED GOOD TO ONE PEOPLE SEEMED SHAME AND DISGRACE TO ANOTHER: THUS I FOUND. I FOUND MUCH THAT WAS CALLED EVIL IN ONE PLACE WAS IN ANOTHER DECKED WITH PURPLE HONOURS.

item.title: 13 Of love of one\'s neighbor
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 13 Of love of one’s neighbor 2 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF LOVE OF ONE’S NEIGHBOR YOU FLEE TO YOUR NEIGHBOR AWAY FROM YOURSELVES AND WOULD LIKE TO MAKE A VIRTUE OF IT: BUT I SEE THROUGH YOUR ‘SELFLESSNESS’.DO I EXHORT YOU TO LOVE OF YOUR NEIGHBOR? I EXHORT YOU RATHER TO FLIGHT FROM YOUR NEIGHBOR AND TO LOVE OF THE MOST DISTANT!

item.title: 14 Of the way of the creator
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 14 Of the way of the creator 3 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE WAY OF THE CREATOR. MY BROTHER, DO YOU WANT TO GO APART AND BE ALONE? DO YOU WANT TO SEEK THE WAY TO YOURSELF? PAUSE JUST A MOMENT AND LISTEN TO ME. ‘HE WHO SEEKS MAY EASILY GET LOST HIMSELF. IT IS A CRIME TO GO APART AND BE ALONE’ – THUS SPEAKS THE HERD.

item.title: 15 Of justice
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 15 Of justice 3 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF JUSTICE WHEN YOU HAVE AN ENEMY, DO NOT REQUITE HIM GOOD FOR EVIL: FOR THAT WOULD MAKE HIM ASHAMED. BUT PROVE THAT HE HAS DONE SOMETHING GOOD TO YOU. BETTER TO BE ANGRY THAN MAKE ASHAMED! AND WHEN YOU ARE CURSED, I DO NOT LIKE IT THAT YOU THEN WANT TO BLESS.

item.title: 16 Of voluntary death
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 16 Of voluntary death 4 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF VOLUNTARY DEATH MANY DIE TOO LATE AND SOME DIE TOO EARLY. STILL THE DOCTRINE SOUNDS STRANGE: ‘DIE AT THE RIGHT TIME.’ DIE AT THE RIGHT TIME: THUS ZARATHUSTRA TEACHES. TO BE SURE, HE WHO NEVER LIVED AT THE RIGHT TIME COULD HARDLY DIE AT THE RIGHT TIME! BETTER IF HE WERE NEVER TO BE BORN!

item.title: 17 Of the bestowing virtue, part 1
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 17 Of the bestowing virtue, part 1 4 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE BESTOWING VIRTUE PART 1 TELL ME: HOW DID GOLD COME TO HAVE THE HIGHEST VALUE? BECAUSE IT IS UNCOMMON AND USELESS AND SHINING AND MELLOW IN LUSTRE; IT ALWAYS BESTOWS ITSELF. ONLY AS AN IMAGE OF THE HIGHEST VIRTUE DID GOLD COME TO HAVE THE HIGHEST VALUE.

item.title: 18 Of the bestowing virtue, part 2
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 18 Of the bestowing virtue, part 2 5 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE BESTOWING VIRTUE PART 2 HERE ZARATHUSTRA FELL SILENT A WHILE AND REGARDED HIS DISCIPLES LOVINGLY. THEN HE WENT ON SPEAKING THUS, AND HIS VOICE WAS DIFFERENT: STAY LOYAL TO THE EARTH, MY BROTHERS, WITH THE POWER OF YOUR VIRTUE! MAY YOUR BESTOWING LOVE AND YOUR KNOWLEDGE SERVE TOWARDS THE MEANING OF THE EARTH!

item.title: 19 Of the bestowing virtue, part 3
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 19 Of the bestowing virtue, part 3 5 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE BESTOWING VIRTUE.PART THREE WHEN ZARATHUSTRA HAD SAID THESE WORDS HE PAUSED LIKE ONE WHO HAS NOT SAID HIS LAST WORD; LONG HE BALANCED THE STAFF DOUBTFULLY IN HIS HAND. AT LAST HE SPOKE THUS, AND HIS VOICE WAS DIFFERENT: I NOW GO AWAY ALONE, MY DISCIPLES!

item.title: 2 Prologue part 2
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 2 Prologue part 2 27 March 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART 2 ZARATHUSTRA WENT DOWN THE MOUNTAIN ALONE, AND NO ONE MET HIM. BUT WHEN HE ENTERED THE FOREST, AN OLD MAN, WHO HAD LEFT HIS HOLY HUT TO LOOK FOR ROOTS IN THE FOREST, SUDDENLY STOOD BEFORE HIM. AND THE OLD MAN SPOKE THUS TO ZARATHUSTRA:

item.title: 20 On the blissful islands
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 20 On the blissful islands 6 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, ON THE BLISSFUL ISLANDS ZARATHUSTRA HAS RETURNED TO THE MOUNTAINS WHERE HE LIVES A SOLITARY EXISTENCE FOR MANY YEARS – UNTIL ONE MORNING HE HAS A DREAM. FILLED WITH NEW RESOLVE AND AN OVERWHELMING DESIRE TO SHARE HIS WORDS WITH HIS FRIENDS, ZARATHUSTRA SPEAKS THUS: BEHOLD, WHAT ABUNDANCE IS AROUND US!

item.title: 21 Of the compassionate
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 21 Of the compassionate 6 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE COMPASSIONATE AS LONG AS MEN HAVE EXISTED, MAN HAS ENJOYED HIMSELF TOO LITTLE: THAT ALONE, MY BROTHERS, IS OUR ORIGINAL SIN! AND IF WE LEARN BETTER TO ENJOY OURSELVES, WE BEST UNLEARN HOW TO DO HARM TO OTHERS AND TO CONTRIVE HARM. THEREFORE I WASH MY HAND WHEN IT HAS HELPED A SUFFERER, THEREFORE I WIPE MY SOUL CLEAN AS WELL.

item.title: 22 Of the priests
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 22 Of the priests 7 April 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE PRIESTS AND ONE DAY ZARATHUSTRA MADE A SIGN TO HIS DISCIPLES AND SPOKE THESE WORDS TO THEM: HERE ARE PRIESTS: AND ALTHOUGH THEY ARE MY ENEMIES, PASS THEM BY QUIETLY AND WITH SLEEPING SWORDS!... THEY ARE BAD ENEMIES: NOTHING IS MORE REVENGEFUL THAN THEIR HUMILITY. AND HE WHO TOUCHES

item.title: 23 The night song
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌CHAPTER 23 The night song 7 April 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THE NIGHT SONG IT IS NIGHT: NOW DO ALL LEAPING FOUNTAINS SPEAK LOUDER. AND MY SOUL TOO IS A LEAPING FOUNTAIN. IT IS NIGHT: ONLY NOW DO ALL SONGS OF LOVERS AWAKEN. AND MY SOUL TOO IS THE SONG OF A LOVER. SOMETHING UNQUENCHED, UNQUENCHABLE, IS IN ME, THAT WANTS TO SPEAK OUT.

item.title: 3 Prologue part 3
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 3 Prologue part 3 27 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART 3 WHEN ZARATHUSTRA ARRIVED AT THE NEAREST OF THE TOWNS LYING AGAINST THE FOREST, HE FOUND IN THAT VERY PLACE MANY PEOPLE ASSEMBLED IN THE MARKET SQUARE: FOR IT HAD BEEN ANNOUNCED THAT A TIGHT-ROPE WALKER WOULD BE APPEARING. AND ZARATHUSTRA SPOKE THUS TO THE PEOPLE:

item.title: 4 Prologue part 4
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 4 Prologue part 4 28 March 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART 4 WHAT IS THE GREATEST THING YOU CAN EXPERIENCE? IT IS THE HOUR OF THE GREAT CONTEMPT. THE HOUR IN WHICH EVEN YOUR HAPPINESS GROWS LOATHSOME TO YOU, AND YOUR REASON AND YOUR VIRTUE ALSO. THE HOUR WHEN YOU SAY: ‘WHAT GOOD IS MY HAPPINESS? IT IS POVERTY AND DIRT AND A MISERABLE EASE.

item.title: 5 Prologue part 5
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 5 Prologue part 5 28 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART 5 WHEN ZARATHUSTRA HAD SPOKEN THESE WORDS HE LOOKED AGAIN AT THE PEOPLE AND FELL SILENT. THERE THEY STAND (HE SAID TO HIS HEART), THERE THEY LAUGH: THEY DO NOT UNDERSTAND ME, I AM NOT THE MOUTH FOR THESE EARS. MUST ONE FIRST SHATTER THEIR EARS TO TEACH THEM TO HEAR WITH THEIR EYES?

item.title: 6 Prologue part 6
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 6 Prologue part 6 29 March 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, PROLOGUE PART SIX FOLLOWING HIS SPEECH ABOUT THE ULTIMATE MAN, ZARATHUSTRA REALIZES THAT THE PEOPLE HAVE MISUNDERSTOOD HIM, FOR THEY NOW CRY OUT TO HIM FOR THE ULTIMATE MAN, TELLING HIM HE CAN HAVE THE SUPERMAN. WHILE HE PONDERS ON THIS, THE TIGHT-ROPE WALKER BEGINS HIS ACT – WALKING ACROSS A ROPE SUSPENDED HIGH ABOVE THE PEOPLE IN THE MARKET SQUARE, BETWEEN TWO TOWERS.

item.title: 7 Of the three metamorphoses
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 7 Of the three metamorphoses 29 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE THREE METAMORPHOSES I NAME YOU THREE METAMORPHOSES OF THE SPIRIT: HOW THE SPIRIT SHALL BECOME A CAMEL, AND THE CAMEL A LION, AND THE LION AT LAST A CHILD. THERE ARE MANY HEAVY THINGS FOR THE SPIRIT, FOR THE STRONG, WEIGHT-BEARING SPIRIT IN WHICH DWELL RESPECT AND AWE: ITS STRENGTH LONGS FOR THE HEAVY, FOR THE HEAVIEST.

item.title: 8 Of the despisers of the body and the joys and the passions
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 8 Of the despisers of the body and the joys and the passions 30 March 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF THE DESPISERS OF THE BODY YOU SAY ‘I’ AND YOU ARE PROUD OF THIS WORD. BUT GREATER THAN THIS – ALTHOUGH YOU WILL NOT BELIEVE IN IT – IS YOUR BODY AND ITS GREAT INTELLIGENCE, WHICH DOES NOT SAY ‘I’ BUT PERFORMS ‘I’.

item.title: 9 Of live and love and of war and warriors
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 9 Of live and love and of war and warriors 30 March 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OF LIFE AND LOVE WHAT HAVE WE IN COMMON WITH THE ROSEBUD, WHICH TREMBLES BECAUSE A DROP OF DEW IS LYING UPON IT? IT IS TRUE: WE LOVE LIFE, NOT BECAUSE WE ARE USED TO LIVING BUT BECAUSE WE ARE USED TO LOVING.
